Subject: Evolving the Shape of an Eye

I wanted to share with you an unusual application of CPPNs that may provoke=
 other unique ideas for the technology:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/sto=
rsveen_ntnu_masters.pdf  

Anders Storsveen completed this work for a Maste=
rs thesis at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology and has giv=
en me permission to share it.  Anders also visited us at the EPlex lab at U=
CF for one semester last year while working on the project.  

In the proje=
ct, the shape of what roughly correspond to an iris and retina are evolved =
and specified by CPPNs.  The results, which you can see easily by browsing =
the pictures in the thesis, are surprisingly plausible.  Of course, since t=
he evolution of the eye is a popular subject in evolutionary theory, it is =
interesting to see an algorithm actually evolve the shape of an eye.

The q=
uestion it raises to me is what other types of objects can be evolved throu=
gh CPPNs other than the traditional ones we are concentrating on in the pre=
sent.

ken
